responses: You can apply for admissions at TIET through the official portal: https://www.thapar.edu/admissions Admission is based on merit, JEE Main, and 12th-grade scores.

Admissions typically open in January. The process involves submitting an online application, appearing for counseling if required, and document verification. More details at https://www.thapar.edu/admissions
For BTech, admission is through JEE Main scores. For other programs, please check the specific requirements at https://www.thapar.edu/admissions
The fee structure varies by program. For the most accurate and updated information, please visit: https://www.thapar.edu/fee-structure
BTech fees are approximately ₹3.5 lakhs per year. Exact details can be found here: https://www.thapar.edu/fee-structure
Fee structure depends on the program and category. Please check the official website: https://www.thapar.edu/fee-structure
TIET offers BTech (8 branches), MTech (15+ specializations), MBA, MSc (Physics, Chemistry, Math), MA (English, Economics), and PhD programs.
You can explore all programs at: https://www.thapar.edu/academics The main BTech branches are CSE, ECE, ME, CE, CHE, and BIOT.
TIET provides undergraduate, postgraduate, and doctoral programs in Engineering, Sciences, Management, and Humanities. Full list: https://www.thapar.edu/academics

patterns: How are the placements at TIET?
responses: TIET has excellent placement records with 90%+ placement rate. Top recruiters include Microsoft, Amazon, Deloitte, Goldman Sachs, and more. Average package is ₹10 LPA.
Placement details for recent years are available at: https://www.thapar.edu/placements The highest package last year was ₹42 LPA.
TIET's dedicated placement cell ensures great opportunities. 200+ companies visit campus annually. See more at: https://www.thapar.edu/placements
Yes, TIET provides separate hostel accommodation for boys and girls, equipped with Wi-Fi, mess, and recreational facilities. Hostel fee is approx. ₹1 lakh/year.
Hostel is optional but recommended. Facilities include 24/7 security, laundry, common rooms, and dining. More info: https://www.thapar.edu/hostels
TIET has 10+ hostels with various amenities. First-year students get priority. Check details at: https://www.thapar.edu/hostels
The Nava Nalanda Central Library is open 8AM-12AM daily with 1 lakh+ books and online journals access. Website: https://library.thapar.edu
TIET's library provides digital resources, study spaces, and research support. Details: https://library.thapar.edu
Yes, students can access IEEE, Springer, and other e-resources through the library portal: https://library.thapar.edu

patterns: Is there a food court at TIET?
responses: TIET has multiple canteens and a modern food court offering hygienic North Indian, South Indian, Chinese, and fast food options.
Campus has 5+ eating places including a 24/7 cafe. The main food court serves meals from ₹50-150. Outside food delivery is also available.
Food options include hostel mess (optional), food court, and specialty cafes. Menu and timings: https://www.thapar.edu/campus-life
Local buses and autos are available. The nearest railway station is Patiala (5km). Chandigarh airport is 65km away. Campus map: https://www.thapar.edu/map
TIET provides shuttle services from Patiala. Many students use Uber/Ola. Detailed directions: https://www.thapar.edu/location
The nearest major transport hubs are Patiala Railway Station (5km) and Chandigarh Airport (65km). Taxis are easily available.
Midterms are usually in weeks 8-9, finals in week 16-17. Check the academic calendar: https://www.thapar.edu/academic-calendar
Exam schedules vary by department. The general academic calendar is available at: https://www.thapar.edu/academic-calendar
TIET follows semester system with mid-semester and end-semester exams. Current schedule: https://www.thapar.edu/academic-calendar

patterns: What happens if attendance is low?
responses: TIET mandates 75% attendance in each course to be eligible for exams. Medical leave can be considered with documentation.
Yes, 75% attendance is compulsory. Students below this may be debarred from exams. Details in academic regulations: https://www.thapar.edu/academics
The attendance policy is strict. Students with <75% may need to repeat the course. Check department guidelines for exceptions.
TIET has excellent sports facilities including cricket, basketball, football, badminton, tennis, swimming pool, and gym. Annual sports fest is URJA.
The sports complex includes indoor and outdoor facilities. Equipment can be borrowed. More info: https://www.thapar.edu/sports
TIET encourages sports with facilities for 20+ games and regular inter-college tournaments. See sports calendar: https://www.thapar.edu/sports
TIET hosts multiple fests: Saturnalia (Tech fest in March), Aagaaz (Cultural fest in October), and Urja (Sports fest in February).
Major annual events include Saturnalia (Asia's largest tech fest), Aagaaz cultural fest, and various department events. Details: https://www.thapar.edu/events
Don't miss Saturnalia - our flagship tech fest with 100+ events, 5000+ participants! More at: https://saturnalia.thapar.edu
You can call +91-175-2393021 or email info@thapar.edu. For specific departments, check: https://www.thapar.edu/contact
Main contact: +91-175-2393021, info@thapar.edu. Address: Thapar Institute of Engineering & Technology, Patiala 147004 Punjab, India
Visit the contact page for department-wise numbers: https://www.thapar.edu/contact Campus map: https://www.thapar.edu/map

Yes, scholarships are available based on academic merit and JEE ranks. Check details at https://www.thapar.edu/scholarships
TIET offers merit scholarships (up to 100% tuition fee waiver) and need-based aid. Application process: https://www.thapar.edu/scholarships
Various scholarships include Institute Merit Scholarship, SC/ST scholarships, and special category aid. More info: https://www.thapar.edu/scholarships
TIET offers vibrant campus life with 50+ clubs (technical, cultural, sports), annual fests, and excellent infrastructure. See: https://www.thapar.edu/campus-life
Beyond academics, students enjoy clubs like Robotics, Dance, Music, Entrepreneurship, and more. Campus tour: https://www.thapar.edu/virtual-tour
The 250-acre green campus has modern facilities, active student community, and round-the-clock activities. Learn more: https://www.thapar.edu/campus-life

Yes! TIET has 100+ international collaborations for student exchange, joint degrees, and research. Partners include universities in USA, Europe, and Australia. Details: https://www.thapar.edu/international
Students can participate in semester exchanges, summer schools, and joint research through our global partnerships. More info: https://www.thapar.edu/international
TIET's International Relations Office facilitates exchanges with top universities worldwide. Check opportunities: https://www.thapar.edu/international

patterns: Can I do research at Thapar?
responses: TIET encourages research with 20+ centers of excellence, funded projects, and undergraduate research programs. Explore: https://www.thapar.edu/research
Yes! Students can join faculty-led research projects. The university has state-of-the-art labs and ₹50+ crore annual research funding. More: https://www.thapar.edu/research
Research is strong in AI, Renewable Energy, Materials Science, and more. See current projects: https://www.thapar.edu/research
